definition: to carry on as before/to follow (an old custom etc)
along/to follow (a line, tradition etc)/to carry on/to trim (a border with braid, tape etc)/border/edge
to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)

sentences.english: The newly-opened store inherits South Beauty's constant features of fashion and innovation.
sentences.chinese: 新店沿襲了俏江南時尚創新的經營特色。

sentences.english: Pacheco's transfer continued a trend of teenagers leaving Barcelona for the Premier League.
sentences.chinese: 帕切科的轉會沿襲了巴塞羅那青少年出走英超的傳統。

sentences.english: The plug-in model we use today is largely theone inherited from the web's early days.
sentences.chinese: 我們今天使用的接插模型，主要從早期網絡沿襲而來。

sentences.english: Several European countries rang in the new year in new ways.
sentences.chinese: 除了這些新鮮的慶祝方式外，一些舊傳統也被沿襲。

sentences.english: The new Camry will have a lot to live up to.
sentences.chinese: 新款凱美瑞將沿襲過去的一系列優勢。

sentences.english: The custom has continued from the 16th century downward.
sentences.chinese: 這種風俗自十六世紀沿襲下來。

sentences.english: Each language usually adopts the convention of one early language only.
sentences.chinese: 這些程式語言通常僅沿襲自一種早先語言的習慣。

sentences.english: Resumption of college entrance examination in 1977, the country still adhere to this provision.
sentences.chinese: 1977年恢復高考後，國家仍然沿襲了這一規定。

sentences.english: The plug-in model we use today is largely theone inherited from the web’s early days.
sentences.chinese: 我們今天使用的接插模型，主要從早期網絡沿襲而來。

sentences.english: We should keep up our good traditions.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該沿襲我們的優良傳統。

sentences.english: Sui and Tang dynasties, the ancient light of prevailing winds, and follow-on generations.
sentences.chinese: 隋唐以後，歷代燈火之風盛行，並沿襲傳於後世。

sentences.english: Albanian popular music (këngë popullore) is generally based on Italian models.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾巴尼亞流行歌曲主要是沿襲意大利的模式。

sentences.english: The distribution of the seismic deformation band coincides with that of the Chenghai fault zone.
sentences.chinese: 地震形變帶沿襲程海斷裂分佈。

sentences.english: Park House is a column with the high ground, followed by the history of Tianzhu Weibei built.
sentences.chinese: 憑柱閣是園內的制高點，因沿襲天柱魏碑的歷史而建。

sentences.english: U.S.-listed shares of some big European banks followed the same trajectory.
sentences.chinese: 一些歐洲銀行的股票沿襲了大盤的走勢。

sentences.english: Not the ancient, talking about the Qing Dynasty and early Qing Dynasty, followed the next system.
sentences.chinese: 遠古的不說，就清朝說起，清初，沿襲明制。

definition: to inherit/to succeed to (the throne etc)/to carry on (a tradition etc)
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
to load into/to record/to write into/to enter (data)/to go into (the records)/to go down (in history)
